docs.lead_paragraph: When Ralph Nader, the Don Quixote of American consumerdom, recently tilted his lance at the so-called enzyme detergents, a top chemical manufacturer was heard to remark wryly, "At last, enzymes have made the big time."

headline.main: Enzyme Explosion; Amid Furore, Enzymes Boom

docs.abstract: comment on rise in use of enzyme detergents by US indus and attacks on their use; mfr of enzymes traced
docs.snippet: When Ralph Nader, the Don Quixote of American consumerdom, recently tilted his lance at the so-called enzyme detergents, a top chemical manufacturer was heard to remark wryly, "At last, enzymes have made the big time."
